title: Lady Gaga subtly reveals she’s single after Dan Horton split claims
text:
Lady Gaga is single and ready to mingle (Picture: The Image Direct – Lady Gaga)

Lady Gaga has revealed she’s no longer dating sound engineer Dan Horton via a subtle Instagram story.

The 33-year-old Shallow singer took to social media to post a series of photos from friend Sarah Nicole Tanno’s bachelorette party.

Referencing her recent fall during her Enigma tour, she wrote as a caption in a selfie: ‘I might be in a lot of pain but I couldn’t miss my best friend’s bachelorette dinner.

‘I [heart] you [Sarah Tanno].’

And then came the announcement of her new relationship status.

On a photo with bestie Sarah, she added: ‘An about-to-be-married woman and me, a single lady’.

She let her single status spill out on Instagram (Picture: Instagram)

Lady Gaga was first seen locking lips with Dan Horton in public back in July.

Dan has been working with Lady Gaga since November 2018, but has also been in the studio with other popstars including Ariana Grande, Justin Timberlake and Bruno Mars.

The music executive reportedly owns Audio Engineering Consulting Group.

Gaga had been dealing with heartbreak this year following the end of her engagement to Christian in February.

After the sad news was revealed right before the Grammy Awards, an insider claimed: ‘It just didn’t work out. Relationships sometimes end.

‘There’s no long dramatic story,’ she added.

Lady Gaga confirms split with Dan Horton (Picture: GoffPhotos.com)

The Born This Way singer was then romantically linked to her A Star Is Born co-star Bradley Cooper but both denied having an affair while he was in a relationship with model Irina Shayk.

Footage emerged this week of the accident at Gaga’s first show back on her Enigma residency in Las Vegas, which saw her tumble off the stage, with the fan landing on top of her in the pit in front of the stage.

While she carried on with the show, she no doubt felt pretty battered after the fall, as she later revealed she had had extensive X-rays to check she hadn’t broken anything.

She posted an X-ray slide of her hand holding up the ‘ok’ sign, writing: ‘When they have to X-Ray almost your entire body…Just Dance. Gonna be ok’.
